title: Lusztig sheaves and integrable highest weight modules
abstract: We consider the localization $\mathcal{Q}_{\mathbf{V},\mathbf{W}}/\mathcal{N}_{\mathbf{V}}$ of Lusztig's sheaves for framed quivers, and define functors $E^{(n)}_{i},F^{(n)}_{i},K^{\pm}_{i},n\in \mathbb{N},i \in I$ between the localizations. With these functors, the Grothendieck group of localizations realizes the irreducible integrable highest weight modules $L(Λ)$ of quantum groups. Moreover, the nonzero simple perverse sheaves in localizations form the canonical bases of $L(Λ)$. We also compare our realization (at $v \rightarrow 1$) with Nakajima's realization via quiver varieties and prove that the transition matrix between canonical bases and fundamental classes is upper triangular with diagonal entries all equal to $\pm 1$.
